page.lettertext:
Belgia 1589 8 May To M
r
Secretary
It may please yo
r
Ho
r
although I have byn visyted w
th
a paynefull
dissenterye, & hardly able as yet, by reason of my weaknes, to continew
my writing, yet I could not omyt to entreat yo
r
Ho. to afford a good
welcome to
M
r
Loozen
and
M
r
Valck
so as they may see by th'effect
that I have written in theyre favour. I will not saie so much for
Mons
r
Egmond
that is w
th
them, for that I have found him a perverse &
ill affected
son to
e Englishe nation. Howbeyt the dealing of the
oth
r
two hath bin allwaies very temperate in the bett
r
kynde.
And for myne owne
ticular I have had
suche
tryall of theyr [loving]
disposition, as in these opportunityes I cannot but endevour to
[s]hew my self gratefull
& so recommending the good interteyneng
of them to yo
r
Honorable Custome I take my humble leave
from
e Hagh May 1589
